fields.description:
h2. Description

Currently, it is not possible to modify the "actor" or user that the Proforma app operates under.
h2. Suggestion

It would be great to have the ability to modify the user the Proforma apps operates as or have it automatically pick the user when they perform a Proforma initiated task/action.
h2. Additional details

For example, in tickets, the worklog displays *ProformaJ* in the activities. Or when receiving email notifications that were initiated by Proforma, these are sent from a user called "ProformaJ".

This can be confusing to users of JSM and end-users who receive email notifications.
fields.summary: Ability to modify the default Proforma actor/user "ProformaJ"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a user is an Agent in a Service Project, they will have access to the *Bulk Actions on queues.* Some administrators may want to remove this ability from Agents and currently, this is not possible.
h3. Suggested Solution

Validate if the Agent has the *Make bulk changes* global permission, if not, they should not be able to use {*}Bulk Actions on queues{*}.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to remove the ability for agents to perform bulk actions on queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[GET IQL objects endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-iql/#api-iql-objects-get] does not escape encoded ampersand (%26) in the query parameter
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object and add an attribute where its value has the & character 
 # Try to query this object using the [GET IQL objects endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-iql/#api-iql-objects-get]

h3. Expected Results

The encoded & character (%26) will be correctly escaped and the query will return the object
h3. Actual Results

The encoded & character (%26) is not being escaped and it is making the request understand that any value after it will be another query string parameter, which will result in an incorrect search or sometimes breaking the request
h3. Workaround

Use the [POST /object/navlist/iql|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-object/#api-object-navlist-iql-post] instead, this way you will be able to pass the & character through the body payload without having issues
fields.summary: IQL objects endpoint does not escape encoded ampersand (&) in the query parameter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While trying to add a video file as an attachment in the customer portal from a browser on iOS, the upload appears stuck and we are unable to submit the request
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a browser in an iOS phone.
 # Open the customer portal to create a request and attach a video file.

h3. Expected Results

The video file gets attached and we are able to submit the request successfully
h3. Actual Results

The upload appears stuck and we are unable to proceed further.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to upload a video file while creating a request from a browser on IOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Incorporate buttons/blocks on the portal like seen for "Projects" which are hyper linked - so that on click the hyperlinked URL open in a different browser tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In reference to the screenshot attached, customer wants that the portal must have buttons/blocks which are hyper linked - so that on clicking the hyperlinked URL open in a different browser tab, just like we have for Projects.

h3. Expected Results:

Additional blocks/button similar to "V8 Support Operations" and "V9 Support Operations" - which upon click - open a specific URL in new browser tab as per the screenshot attached
h3. Actual Results:

It is not possible as of now
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Incorporate buttons/blocks on the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight has weekly maintenance wherein a customer instance may be down for up to 5 minutes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an Insight instance on a Wednesday, between 00:00 and 03:00 UTC

h3. Expected Results

Insight is available
h3. Actual Results

Insight may be down for up to 5 minutes
h3. Workaround

Periodically refresh the page until the instance is back.
fields.summary: Insight instance is down for up to 5 minutes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for objects in Insight field in issue view, the result sometimes shows the correct object then refreshes again and shows "No options". Sometimes, it shows "No options" then loads again then shows the correct object.

*Note:* This is easier to replicate when the Insight field is configured with a large object schema (> 2000 objects)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the name of the Insight object you want to search for in the Insight field
 # Navigate to the issue with the Insight field
 # Edit the Insight field
 # Paste the name in the search
 # See that the field dropdown shows the correct object then starts loading then shows "No options" 

[^Screen Recording 2021-12-03 at 4.01.41 pm.mov]
h3. Expected Results

The field should load then show the correct object.
h3. Actual Results

The field shows the correct object then starts loading then shows "No options".
h3. Workaround

You can modify the search string until the dropdown shows the correct objects and doesn't reload.
fields.summary: Searching in Insight field on issue view intermittently shows "No options"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a request is created in agent view and the assignee is set during creation, the action does not meet the conditions *Assignee: Changed* or *Assignee: From Unassigned*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an SLA "Time to First Response"
 # Set a condition for the SLA to stop with *Assignee: Changed* and *Assignee: From Unassigned*.
 # Create a request via the agent view and assign the issue during the creation

h3. Expected Results

The SLA "Time to First Response" would have the cycle completed upon creation.
h3. Actual Results

The SLA "Time to First Response" would continue running until it meets the next configured stop condition then will recalculate to show the SLA stops upon creation
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Remove the operation that's setting the assignee and assign the request after the ticket is created
fields.summary: Assigning issue when creating request prevents SLA to stop

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Service Management reports, when selecting a Custom range, it shows a day prior to the day selected on the calendar.
The results are correct, but the *From* and *To* dates show incorrectly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the project > Go to *Reports* > Select the report you will work on > Select *Custom Range* date > Select dates of the fields *From* and *To*

h3. Expected Results

The dates selected on the date picker *From* and {*}To{*}, both should be exactly the same dates selected on the calendar. 
h3. Actual Results

The *From* and *To* date picker always changes to a day prior to the day selected on the calendar.
!Screen Recording 12-2-2021 at 11.49 AM.gif! 
Even if the dates on the date picker show incorrect, the result of the report is correct, as it was selected.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom date range on reports shows a day prior to the one selected

fields.description: Customers would like to be able to change the template for stakeholder updates from what the initial update used.
fields.summary: Ability to select templates for stakeholder updates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Intermittently SLA calculations are not displayed on the issue view UI. When the new issue is created SLA section is displayed blank, however after some time SLA's are displayed and show the SLA calculation correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Unable to reproduce as the issue is intermittent

h3. Expected Results

SLA timer should be displayed under the SLA section when expected.
h3. Actual Results

SLA section is displayed blank in issue view and SLA information is missing.

!Screenshot 2021-12-02 at 4.11.32 PM.png|width=191,height=68!

Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SLA calculations are delayed or do not appear on the UI timely.

fields.description:
At the moment, when collaborators(users without a JSM license) view filters and if that filters have Insight custom fields, they get the following message:
!image-2021-12-02-13-44-35-540.png|width=304,height=154!
h4. Suggested Solution:

As collaborators are able to view Insight field data in the issue view, allow them to be able to view Insight data in filter view.
fields.summary: Allow collaborators to view Insight custom fields data in filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Only 10 groups are returned when searching by name for a group when adding that group to a role in Insight.  The returned list is not sorted by length, so an exact match may not be returned in favor of 10 other groups that match the query, but are longer in length.  For instance, if I had the following groups:
 # a-b
 # a-c
 # a-d
 # a-e
 # a-f
 # a-g
 # a-h
 # a-i
 # a-j
 # a-k
 # a-

and attempted to add `a-`, I would not be able to , as groups 1-10 would be returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 10 groups to an instance, all with the same prefix
 # Make an 11th group whose name is only the prefix
 # Navigate to the Role configuration page on Insight (/jira/servicedesk/insight/configure)
 # Type in the prefix as the group name

h3. Expected Results

* Prefix only group is available to add
h3. Actual Results

* First 10 groups creates are returned, not including the exact match
h3. Workaround


Rename the group or create a nested group that contains the desired group and then add that nested group.
fields.summary: Searching for a group by name when attempting to add the group to a role may not return the correct group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to create a customer on service desk project isn't working as expected if the customer is already created by another project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation to add customers to the service desk project(Project A) using webhook
 # Perform the same activity on couple more projects(Project B and Project C) and initiate a webhook.
 # Once the webhook is received if the Automation on Project A gets initiated and completes the creation of the customer.
 # Then the Automation of Project B and Project C fails with the below error and the user doesn't get added to the service project as well.
 ** 
{quote}This request is invalid. Check that the request contains all the required parameters and that the parameters are valid. (email : An account already exists for this email
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

The account should get added as a customer to all the service desk projects where the Automation is executed. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Automation Audit log file
{noformat}
This request is invalid. Check that the request contains all the required parameters and that the parameters are valid. (email : An account already exists for this email) {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround found
fields.summary: Automation to create customer using webhook isn't working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, it's not possible to restrict users to only being able to view certain object types in an Insight object schema. Granting the user a 'user' role in a schema will open up the entire schema, and there is no option on the object type level to restrict the visibility of the object type to just a limited number of users.


h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to have the option to allow setting 'view' permissions on the object type level in an object schema.

h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: As an Admin I would like to be able to restrict Insight users to only be able to view certain object type in an object schema

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When submitting the schema and mapping for an external import with parent/child object types, the referenced object attributes are not created when those attributes refer to a child object type. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new or existing object schema
 # Navigate to imports tab
 # Create an import configuration to "Connect another app" with a generated token
 # Generate token
 # Follow steps 1-2 as listed here ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/imports/workflow/)]
 # Use attached JSON to submit mapping as listed in step 3 (specifies parent object type with referenced objects of child object types)
 # View object type(s) in object schema

h3. Expected Results

Object type structures are created with specified hierarchy and contain attributes of referenced objects.
h3. Actual Results

Object type structures are created with specified hierarchy but do not contain attributes of referenced objects.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Submitting a mapping for an external import with referenced child object type does not work

fields.description: Currently Internal notes are highlighted in yellow when saved. Requesting comment box be highlighted when internal comment is created and edited. This would help prevent internal comments being published as customer comments
fields.summary: Requesting "Add internal note" color to be yellow when creating/editing comment

fields.description:
*Problem:*

When a Jira Server to Jira Cloud migration is performed, both users and customers are migrated to Atlassian Cloud.

In a situation where a user is an Agent in some Projects whereas a Customer (only) in the other projects, their account exists as Customer as well as user on the Jira instance.

This leads to a major confusion as the same email address is shown twice while Assigning issues etc.

Since the email address remains the same, data is mapped incorrectly to either one of these accounts.

*Workaround:*

Currently we ask the Admins to perform a "Migrate to Atlassian Account" for these affected users.

Doing this manually for a large user base becomes pretty taxing for the Admins.

*Proposed Solution:*

Jira needs to have the ability to identify customers who have User accounts with same email address and merge them post migration.
fields.summary: Ability to merge Atlassian Accounts with Customer Accounts if the email address of the users match

fields.description: Currently, a user needs to enter all the email addresses manually one by one to share a request with multiple users. We are looking for an option to enter all the email addresses in one go like using an operator(,) separated and Jira should be able to detect the email addresses.
fields.summary: Allow users to add multiple email addresses using the share with option on Customer portal

fields.description:
Restrict ticket creation to some customers.

Project should be created so that only selected Customer can can create issues.
They should be able to pick all the customers and other customer shouldn't be able to view.
fields.summary: Restrict ticket creation to some customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Opsgenie can transition issues when an alert is closed using both JSW/JSM integrations, this requires your workflow to have a transition called *Resolve the issue.* If this transition has a screen to set values for fields, Opsgenie will ignore it.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * When closing an alert, open a pop up to request the values for those fields
 * Or allow the integration to use *Extra Properties* from alerts to set field values
fields.summary: Add the ability to set values for fields in Jira when closing an alert in Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For projects created using option 'share settings with an existing project', language translation for "Summary" field label does not work on 'request create' page in customer portal.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new project and select option 'share settings with an existing project' during creation.
# Go to project settings -> Request type. Select 'Request form' tab for any request type and add "Summary" field.
# Go to project settings ->  language support,  add new language and relevant translation for "Summary" field label.
# Open customer portal and request create page for request type configured in step 2

h3. Expected Results
The "Summary" field should get translated.

h3. Actual Results
"Summary" field does not translated.



h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Language translation for any fields do not work on request create portal page

fields.description:
_Can you add the number of widget users to the servicedesk report "requests deflected"?_

_We saw that visitors of an article in the portal are added to the report of deflected requests. But the visitors that visit the same article via the Jira Service desk widget are not added to that report. Is it possible to count them too or seperately?_
fields.summary: Add the number of widget users to the servicedesk report "requests deflected"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Approve/Decline rule in Automation for Jira fails intermittently due to the instance's high database usage.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # To reproduce, the instance should have a high database load.
 # Go to the impacted project {*}> Project Settings{*}.
 # Go to *Automation.* Find the automation with the errors.
 # Go to {*}Audit Log{*}.
 # Look for entries with *Some errors.*
 # Click on the entry.

h3. Expected Results

The Approve/Decline rule is successful.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
There was a problem with attempting auto approve/decline in Jira. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian support.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

Contact the Atlassian Support team to verify if this is the bug you're experiencing.
fields.summary: Approve/Decline rule on Automation for Jira fails intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we edit the SLA and save without any changes, it triggers an SLA recalculation for all issues in the project. However, if you verify the logs we see no events of recalculation happening.

The indexing will be stuck for hours without any progress
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Project settings -> SLA
 # Click on Edit, make NO changes and then SAVE
 # Go to any queue (where you have the SLA columns added) and you’ll see all the SLA’s indexing

h3. Expected Results

Since there is no change the configuration, a recalculation(SLA indexing) is not triggered
h3. Actual Results

The issues show the indexing warning for SLA. Appears to be stuck in this state for hours.
h3. Workaround

Manually force recalculation for affected tickets as shown in [SLAs in Jira Service Management are missing or disappear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-desk-cloud-are-missing-or-disappear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: Editing and saving SLA without making any actual changes triggers SLA indexing on all issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to change the ITSM category for a Request Type that is already assigned to a category. 


Suggested Solution
Allow modifying the ITSM category for an existing request type that is already assigned to another category.

Workaround
Remove and/or add a new Request Type and assign it to the desired category
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to be to change the ITSM category for Request Types that are already assigned to another category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporing the CSV list of managed accounts, the column E of the CSV file shows the "Last active" date for that account. This column does not reflect the login in JSM portal, even though the authentication happens on the id platform (with SAML, if enforced)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an organization with some managed accounts
 # One of the accounts has access to a JSM portal
 # The user logs in to the portal and raises a ticket

h3. Expected Results
The CSV file should show the "Last active" date the date when the user logged-in to the portal

h3. Actual Results
The CSV file shows the last active date the date when the user logged-in to a product with full user access (licensed account)

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Last active column in managed accounts export file does not consider portal access

fields.description:
ability to migrate atlassian account to Portal customer account
 * Currently we can convert atlassian account to Portal customer account by removing access to products and provide just site access
 * Doing this will not reflect customer account under User management> Jira Service Management
fields.summary: ability to migrate atlassian account to Portal customer account

fields.description: Currently it's not possible to customize CSS of CSAT survey as it is hardcoded. It would be great if we could customize it.
fields.summary: Ability to customize CSS of CSAT survey

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it isn't possible for a customer to:
1. Add reactions to comments on customer portal
2. View reactions made by agents

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow service project admins to enable customers to add emoji reactions to comments and view them.


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow emoji reactions rendering on customer portal

fields.description:
*Problem description*

Currently, only Incidents can associate Impacted Services.

*Suggested solution*

Add the ability to add Impacted Services to alerts as well.
fields.summary: Add the ability to associate Services with alerts

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

There is already a feature to export all JSM customers from User Management page. However, at times users want to know who have the access to certain project.

h3. Suggested resolution

Improve the current feature to generate list of JSM customers for each project.
fields.summary: Provide feature to export JSM customer per project

fields.description:
It is very difficult for responders to see who created a problem in the corresponding alert.

You have to know the service and then dig deep to see the owner. It would be great if the original creator gets added to the alert. As a tag? Or any other way.
Even a link to the original problem would suffice, you only see a problem id now.
fields.summary: Add problem creator to the corresponding alert.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today, the filtering options for assets are limited to the options listed in the {{query}} parameter of the [GET /rest/assetapi/asset/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/assetsapi/rest/api-group-assets/#api-asset-search-get] REST API endpoint. This doesn't cover the ability to filter for one or more specific fields.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to filter on the additional fields that can be defined for an asset.

h3. Workaround
While this will not achieve the goal because it doesn't provide the ability to search on a specific field, the current search can be used if the values are also present as {{label}}, {{origin}} and {{fields}}.
fields.summary: As an app developer, I want to be able to filter by the asset fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to update the "Linked Major Issue" in the JIRA issue via the rest API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a public REST API for admin to update "Linked Major Incident" in existing JSM issue.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to update "Linked Major Incident" via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Child value set as empty while transitioning a ticket within a JSM Queue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a cascading field that has two level values.
# Add this field to a screen that is used on a workflow transition.
# Start the transition within a JSM Queue
# Set a value for the "parent" and "child" value for the field created on step one.
 !image-2021-11-23-17-34-47-911.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The ticket should be transitioned and keep both values selected.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is transitioned but the "child" value is empty.
 !image-2021-11-23-17-36-56-620.png|thumbnail! 

Also, if we have a workflow validator the transition it will fail.

h3. Workaround
Access the ticket and then make a transition from there instead of doing it from the queue itself.
fields.summary: Child value set as empty while transitioning a ticket within a JSM Queue

fields.description:
h3. Issue

The auto complete results within the *Request Participants* field in Jira Service Management projects does not currently have any specific sorting done on the results. Due to this, a user making several searches may see the same list displayed in a different order between searches as well as be uncertain where the user they are looking for can be easily found in cases where a large number of results are returned.
h3. Recommendation

This inconsistent behavior is not an ideal user experience and should be standardized to provide a consistent and expected user experience. The list should be ordered, such as alphabetically to provide a consistent experience.
fields.summary: Sort Request Participants auto complete list

fields.description: Looking for a feature to share request with every customer in a service project without having to use organization
fields.summary: ability to share every customer without organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLA timer continues to run despite the issue meeting the STOP condition(Resolution is set)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure SLA to START when Issue is Created and only ONE stop condition, i.e, Resolution is set
 # In the workflow, in transitions leading to the resolved status add a transition screen with the resolution field and a post-function to update the resolution
 # Create an issue and move it to Closed status
 # Despite seeing a resolution set, you will still find the SLAs running

h3. Expected Results

The SLA timer stops
h3. Actual Results

The SLA timer continues to run and eventually breach.
You will see an update in the resolution field in Issue history.
!Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 2.49.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Remove either the resolution field from the transition screen or the post-function that updates the resolution field.

For the affected issues, add another STOP condition such as *Entered Status: Closed* and run a manually recalculation on those issues following steps shown in [SLAs in Jira Service Management are missing or disappear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-desk-cloud-are-missing-or-disappear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: SLA not stopping despite the STOP condition being met when resolution is set twice on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the columns are added or removed from the portal and *Done* button is pressed, the changes do not take effect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Requests page on the portal and click the *three vertical dots > Manage Columns*.
 !image-2021-11-23-14-39-52-938.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add/remove some columns as per the requirement and click *Done*.
 # Now, refresh the page and notice how the changes did not take effect.

h3. Expected Results
The changes should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The same columns are displayed as before.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Manage columns is not taking changes on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In New issue view single user-picker custom field does not apply the group filtering configured for the field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a single user picker custom field by accessing Jira Settings > Issues > Custom field > Add custom field. 
# Add that custom field to a screen.
# Access that's custom field setting page and setup group/filter to a group with few users in it.
# Go to the project where that screen is placed and with the new issue view enabled, try to edit that custom field option. 

 !Configure_Custom_Field__USER_PICKER_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The only users are shown are in the filter/group configured for the field.

h3. Actual Results
All users are displayed.

h3. Notes
The *User picker* custom field literally displays ALL users including Portal customers from Jira Service Desk.

h3. Workaround (may not be applicable for some sites as we move to the new issue view)
- Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
# Select your avatar and choose Profile
# Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs
{panel}
fields.summary: User filtering (single user picker) does not work in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, there are no possibility for admin to create Service Registry via REST API

h3. Suggestion
Open public rest API for Admin to use to create new Service Registry
h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to create JSM Service Registry via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When adding groups to Insight roles, the text will say {*}Showing 10 of total 10 groups{*}, even though you have more groups that start with the same text.

This phrase is misleading as it suggests that there are only 10 groups. 

For example, if you have more than 20 groups (Jira1, Jira2, Jira3...) and search for "Jira", it will display the first 10 and the text will say that the total of groups is 10 instead of 20.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would make more sense if the phrase was one of the following:
 * *Showing 10 of total <<total number of groups>> groups*
 * *Showing 10 groups*

h3. Workaround

Type the full name of the group, and it will come up.
fields.summary: Change phrasing in Insight's role editor when adding groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

In Legacy Insight app, it was possible for collaborators(users with a Jira license but no JSM license) to view and enter values in Insight fields that were added in the "Create issue" screen from within main Jira site.
The same is not possible at the moment in the JSM Insight integration. Only users who have a JSM license can view and edit the Insight fields in "Create issue" screen
h3. Suggested Solution

Similar to legacy app, allow the collaborators to view and enter values in Insight fields in "Create issue" screen.
h4. Workaround:

At the moment, you can ask the collaborators to raise a request via customer portal if they want to view and enter the values in the Insight fields
h3.
fields.summary: Allow collaborators to view/edit Insight fields in "Create issue screen"

fields.description: There are many application use cases in which it would be highly useful to generate queue configuration programmatically via the REST API. Doing so should be a trivial functionality since they are based on JQL and filters and should be very quickly implemented. It would greatly expand on the use cases for Service Management Apps.
fields.summary: create and delete queues via REST API

fields.description: SLAs are a powerful feature. While it is possible to get SLA statuses via the API, creating new SLAs is not. Thus, from an app developer perspective, the use cases for using the existing SLA API is highly limitied. Implementing an API should be a quick process and would greatly enhance the use case for developing service desk apps.
fields.summary: create SLAs via API

fields.description: Looking for a feature to change text on satisfaction screen while giving the survey,  !Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 8.48.38 PM.png!
fields.summary: Change text on satisfaction screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
If the object doesn't exist while updating an Insight custom field, user needs to switch to the Insight view to create the object and then go back to the Jira issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to create objects from Jira custom fields

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Add the ability to create objects from Jira custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When typing a _batch_ Comment in Queue > _select multiple issues_ > Comment, the cursor always jumps to the end.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a JSD project and go to Queue > _select multiple issues_ > Comment. This can be reproduced on both "Add internal note" and "Reply to customer" options.
 # Move the text cursor to any different position (to the beginning of the line, for example) and start typing.

h3. Expected Results

The text is added in any desired position of the line.
h3. Actual Results

The cursor always moves to the end of the line.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Text cursor in Queue moves to the end

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Organization view in JSM is throwing the error "missing ac/create".

For more information, please check this page: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~890104860/pages/1365698679/RECON-252+Missing+ac+create+race+condition+in+JSM+connect+app]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # see the above link.

h3. Expected Results

No errors
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Error: "missing ac/create"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Apps are failing with the following error: "missing ac/create"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attributes are displayed in the order the object was created

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object
 # Change the order of the attributes
# Create new object

If you compare both objects, the fields will be displayed in different order.

h3. Expected Results
Objects view respects the order set on Attributes page

h3. Actual Results
Attributes are displayed in the order the object was created
 !Screenshot 2021-11-18 at 15.39.01.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Attributes are displayed in the order the object was created

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time [External Imports|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/imports/workflow/] do not allow you to create a referenced object type and their mapping.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to create a referenced object type and their mapping using External import
fields.summary: Ability to create a referenced object type and their mapping using External import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I've only got this to occur when using a Chrome incognito window. When adding a Lookup object action to a trigger I get the following error:

'Error loading component. An unknown error occurred. Please reload and try again.'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Chrome incognito window and go to the cloud site.
 # In a service project, go to Automation and create a rule.
 # For the trigger, select Issue created.
 # For the new action, select Lookup objects.

h3. Expected Results

The action will load.
h3. Actual Results

I get the following error:
{noformat}
Error loading component. An unknown error occurred. Please reload and try again. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to not use a Chrome incognito window. It works fine with a regular Chrome window, and with Firefox regular windows, and Firefox private windows. This is an issue for us in Atlassian University as students do our labs using a fake atlassian.university account. So they don't mess up their current browser settings, we recommend they use an incognito/private window.
fields.summary: Adding the Lookup object automation action to a rule causes an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a request is created using the JSM Widget and an attachment is added from the Widget, the comment that adds the attachment to the request also stops SLAs that are configured with a stop condition of "Comment: For Customers".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an SLA that has the stop condition "Comment: For Customers".
# Enable the Widget and make sure the Attachment field is required on the request form of the request type used in the widget.
# Create a request from the Widget that contains an attachment

h3. Expected Results
The request is created and the SLAs are running.

h3. Actual Results
SLAs that have the stop condition "Comment: For Customers" stop running immediately due to the comment with the attachment that is added by the user *Jira Service Management Widget*.

h3. Workaround
Remove the attachment field from the Widget by making it optional on the request type
fields.summary: Creating a request with an attachment using the Widget results in some SLAs stopping immediately

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When object import fails and *Process Results* tab shows the error *OBJECT_TYPE_ERRORS* due to attribute having type "Text" has an import value that's longer than 255 characters, the error response is very cryptic.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Import Configuration that imports to an object type with an attribute of type Text
 # Create an import source file that contains an object with attribute of Step 1 that has values longer than 255
 # Start import, it'll fail, and the messages found in API request (https://<customer instance>/gateway/api/jsm/insight/workspace/<workspace_id>/v1/progress/result/objectschema/<object_schema_id>) which is hit via loading "Process Result" tab will contain the following:

{{"<object name>(null): context: rlabs-insight-attribute-<object attribute id>; messages: [ErrorMessage\{i18nKey='rlabs.insight.i18n.constraint.violation.ObjectTypeAttributeBean.Size.name', parameters=[], additionalMessage=null}]; "}}
h3. Expected Results

More readable result for user to self-diagnose and correct
h3. Actual Results

As stated in how to reproduce
h3. Workaround

Change the Type Value of attribute to Textarea instead of Text. If objects partially imported, user would need to delete all objects to change the attribute. Then kick off the import again.

*More detailed steps below:*
 # In Insight section go to the particular object type which shows error during import
 # Click the cog wheel button and bulk delete the existing objects
 # In the same object type, go to the Attributes tab > Find the attribute > Update it's Type Value from Text to Textarea
 # Retry the import
fields.summary: Insight Object Import error message OBJECT_TYPE_ERRORS on attribute "Text" being too long is not very clear

fields.description:
Currently, the display name of the field in the visible field section of the Request type only allows pure text to be used.

This is a suggestion to allow hyperlinks to be used in the display name of the fields along with the text so the user can click on it in order to be redirected.
fields.summary: Ability to add hyperlinks to the display name in visible field section.

fields.description:
*Current behavior:*

To @mention the person in a particular field, for example, the issue's Assignee, one has to enter the following:

{{[~accountId:{{user field name.accountId}}]}}

It becomes difficult for an admin to find the accountId of a user to mention

*Expected behavior:*

The user picker pop-up box should open when typing @ sign to mention a user.
fields.summary: To mention a user, provide an ability to pick user in comment action of Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is opened from the queue and when a user clicks on the Subtask summary of that issue, the subtask opens correctly. But when the back button of the browser is pressed, an issue with Subtask summary and Parent Task's description is shown. Only when pressing the back button one more time, the correct Parent Task is displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with the summary as *Parent Task Summary* and the description as *Parent Task Description* and open it from the queue. Its URL should look something like https://<site_name>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<project_key>/queues/custom/<queue_id>/<issue_key>
 # Create a subtask of this issue with the summary as *Subtask Summary* and the description as {*}Subtask Description{*}.
 # Click the Subtask summary link of the Subtask
!image-2021-11-17-13-34-18-695.png|width=522,height=157!
 # Now, press the back button of the browser. Notice how an issue with Subtask Summary and Parent Task Description is displayed
!image-2021-11-17-13-36-19-632.png|width=513,height=410!

h3. Expected Results

An issue with Parent Task Summary and Parent Task Description should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

An issue with Subtask Summary and Parent Task Description is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Pressing the back button one more time displays the correct Parent Task.
fields.summary: Pressing the back button of the browser returns Subtask summary and Parent task description

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

Currently, if we need to add domains in Allowlist, that needs to be done one at a time at the Project Level.
h3. Expected Behaviour

As an Admin, I'd like to have the ability to create a default set of domains in the Allowlist, so we can use it across all existing mail integrations for team-managed projects in Cloud instances.
h3. User case
 # John is an Administrator who manages some JSM projects;
 # John notices that several JSM projects are having an issue, where emails requests are being rejected due to "Delivery-status email filter" errors;
 # To fix that, John needs to go through each affected project and manually allow each affected domain.
 # In this case, it would be helpful to have a group of domains previously set up and use it for all affected projects. We could use this as a Bulk Add Domains feature for Allowlist.
fields.summary: Ability to create global allowlist for Jira Service Management mail handlers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In specific workstations the bundle fields(from *Extension for Jira Service Management by Deviniti*) are not loading properly in the Jira Service Management portal.

h3. Steps and conditions to reproduce
- Windows O.S;
- Browsers: Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge(Version 95.0.1020.30 (Official build) (64 bits));
[^Screen Recording 2021-11-16 at 12.44.34 PM.mov]
- The behavior also occurs incognito;

h3. Expected Results
The bundle fields should load normally expanding the form.

h3. Actual Results
The bundle fields won't load.

h3. Workaround
Scroll out/zoom out the page, the bundle fields will load correctly.
fields.summary: Bundle fields not loading properly in JSM portal

fields.description:
Users may want to have the ability to configure different phone numbers or unique short code numbers. This would help ensure that a new text message thread is created on the recipient's device, rather than have new alerts added to an existing thread.

Currently it's not possible to configure the phone number that's used. While users are able to add a vCard detailing the existing phone numbers, this wouldn't create a new thread on the telephone and additional messages would be added to existing threads. 

 The current option for alert notifications:
* [Send voice and SMS notifications|https://support.atlassian.com/opsgenie/docs/send-voice-and-sms-notifications/]
fields.summary: Ability to configure different numbers when sending alerts in Opsgenie

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, all the customers who are CC'ed in a service desk email are automatically added as request participants for a ticket.

*Suggested Solution*

Provide an option to disable this feature so that only a manual way of adding request participants will be available for a JIRA service desk project.

*Why this is important*

This will then allow us to better control, who we wish to send the response to from JIRA Service Desk.
fields.summary: Provide Option To Disable Automatic Adding Of Request Participant When They Are CC'ed in an Email

fields.description:
Currently our organization faces adoption issues to the Atlassian suite and I believe one thing that would really help is if we could simplify the interface a bit. At the moment each project has a template (or project type) that determines which components are available with in. Prior to the next-gen model, these components could not be turned on/off, but I've really appreciated the new abilities to turn features on and off, this is so important.

Unfortunately not everything can be controlled this way, especially with 3rd part add-ons. At the moment we have several add-ons that are only needed by specific users within their given team project but unfortunately the sidebar menu has quickly become cluttered with these products on every project. It would be great to have some way of controlling this even if just be CSS removing the item from the menu list interface. Many users only want to see what they need within the context of the project. Now that we've begun adopting Work Management and Service Management projects this has become even more important.
fields.summary: Customized Project Sidebar Menus

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the services are part of a separate object schema called {*}Services{*}. There is *no option to import objects* in that schema like other Insight object schemas.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be option to import services in the *Services* object schema
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Better manageability and versatility of Services schema
 - No need to recreate services in a separate environment thereby reducing manual efforts
 - Improved interoperability between different cloud sites

h3. Workaround

Recreate the services in Services object schema
fields.summary: Ability to import objects in Services object schema of Insight Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading a new import source file to an existing import configuration with the same columns but different data currently does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to edit import configuration
 # Upload the latest version of the file
 # Execute import

h3. Expected Results

Import should honour the changes in the latest version of the import source file.

h3. Actual Results

Import does not honour the changes in the latest version of the import source file. It uses the same values as the first uploaded file.

h3. Workaround

Create a new configuration for the latest version of the file.
fields.summary: Replacing the import source file with the same columns but different data should work

fields.description:
As per Document [Send voice and SMS notifications|https://support.atlassian.com/opsgenie/docs/send-voice-and-sms-notifications/] it states the below:

Opsgenie aggregates SMS notifications and will send SMS messages in at most 1 minute intervals. Events occurring in-between the intervals of 1 minute will be aggregated for the next SMS/Voice notification.

It would be nice to have control over this if a user wants to receive aggregated SMS's or Individual SMS for each Alert even if it was raised within 1 Minute interval.

h4.Steps to Reproduce
Enable SMS notification on a User profile when an Alert is created.
Create Multiple Alerts within a Minute so that the user is notified via SMS

h4.Expected Results
Individual SMS has to be sent for Individual Alerts

h4.Actual Results
Notification for the first Alert is sent as Expected (One SMS notification for One Alert).
All Alerts following that is Aggregated to one SMS and says "You have # Alert Notifications"
fields.summary: Send SMS notification for individial Opsgenie Alerts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inviting a new user/customer (any email that is Not associated with Atlassian account yet) via User Management (without granting any product access), then quickly invite them via People section will grant them with an Agent license. This can't be reproduced all the time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group (ie Testing) in User Management and never assign this as default product access
# Disable new user default product access (not necessary but just to show that it has nothing to do with this)
# Invite a user without granting product access and at the same time, add this user into "Testing" group via User Management (https://url.atlassian.net/admin)
#* The user will be created in UM as a user without any product access
# Add the user as “Service Desk customer” role via People section : https://url.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/<pkey>/people

h3. Expected Results

The new user should Not be granted with JSM product access
h3. Actual Results
The new user is granted with JSM product access

h3. Workaround

Wait a bit longer before adding the new user via People section with "Service Desk customer" role.
fields.summary: Race condition in inviting customer could grant them with an Agent license

fields.description:
Problem :

 It's not possible for customers to access a request on the portal without logging in – they still need to create an account should they wish to view the ticket in the portal. However, if they wish to only continue to communicate over emails, they won't need to complete the signup. This is aligned with [Introducing the login-free portal for Jira Service Desk Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal-for-jira-service-desk-cloud]

Suggestion:

Customers should be able to access ticket in the system without logging in to create a customer account for a login-in free portal
fields.summary: Access ticket in the system without logging in to create an customer account for login-in free portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Cloud Jira Service Management* is connected to a *Confluence Server* instance, where the Confluence Server instance is hosted on a Base URL with a context path (e.g. https://myconfluence.server.com/wiki).

When attempting to connect the Cloud JSM Project to a *Knowledge base* from the Confluence Server instance, the testing of a valid [Authenticate portal user|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/authenticate-portal-users-to-access-knowledge-base-articles] fails with *{color:red}Credentials are invalid{color}.*

 !JSMCloudAuthenticateError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a *Confluence Server* instance with a Base URL that has a context path (e.g. https://myconfluence.server.com/wiki)
#* Create a new user called *testuser* with any password of your choice
# Set up an Application Link from the *Cloud Jira Service Management* to the *Confluence Server* instance Base URL (i.e. to https://myconfluence.server.com/wiki)
# Create a *Cloud Jira Service Management* and go to the *Project Settings* 
# Click on *Knowledge base*
# Unlink the Confluence Cloud Space if it is already linked
# Click *Link Space* and link to a Space from the *Confluence Server* instance
# In the *Authenticate portal users*, enter the earlier created *testuser* and press the (/) to test the authentication

h3. Expected Results

The user authentication test should be successful.

 !JSMCloudAuthenticateSuccessful.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The user authentication test will fail with *{color:red}Credentials are invalid{color}.*:

 !JSMCloudAuthenticateError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Root cause investigation

Cloud JSM invokes the user authentication to the *Confluence Server instance* on the URL without the context path, e.g. https://myconfluence.server.com/rest/api/user/current (x)

Cloud JSM should be invoking the the user authentication to the *Confluence Server instance* on the URL with the context path, e.g. https://myconfluence.server.com/wiki/rest/api/user/current (/)

h3. Workaround

None (unless it is acceptable to run Confluence Server without a context path).
fields.summary: "Authenticate portal users" with Confluence Server fails when Confluence Server Base URL has a context path

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the issue is created via email, by default JSD email processor will render the HTML format and display the value in the Description field. However, if an agent edit the value, and didn't change any formatting or colors, upon saving, the format syntax changed and causing issue history show user edit the description field and notification send to JIRA user (if configured)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send email to JSM email request. Use attached email :-
 [^Test.eml] 
 # Once issue created , open the issue and click the Description field.
# Without changing anything , click *Save*

h3. Expected Results
No update showing in the issue history and no update notification send to JIRA user.

h3. Actual Results
In issue history showed , the description field update. The syntax format been updated :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-11-11 at 5.28.09 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When Issue created via email , the Description value format/renderer syntax are not remain the same if someone edit the Description field

fields.description:
Currently, fields added to the request form are stacked together but it's not possible to separate them into sections.
h3. Suggestion

Implement the ability to add different sections to the request form so fields can be better organized.
fields.summary: Ability to add sections to the request type form

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Browser Back button does not act as expected with the Object Schema List

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Insight > View all object schemas;
 # Click the three-dotted icon to the right of any schema and then on Configure;
 # Click the browser's Back button

h3. Expected Results
You're taken back to the list of your Object Schemas 

h3. Actual Results
You're not taken back to the full list. Instead, you're taken to the Schema you've selected (ie where you can see its objects), or you're not taken back at all and stay on the configuration page.

h3. Workaround
Use the top-bar Insight > View all object schemas path again
fields.summary: Browser Back button does not act as expected with the Object Schema List

fields.description:
Ability to integrate third-party tools with Attribute types like attribute type to store telephone numbers such that it has a clickable value and open phone/skype/teams app to call on the number.

Currently, we don't have such attribute types in the Insight cloud.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this use case. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to integrate third-party tools with Attribute types

fields.description:
Hi!

We have several request types that are no longer used and they are already hidden from the portal, but everyone that have a technician view can create ticket or associate that request type to a ticket.

 

It is very important to have a way to archive the request types that are no longer used and avoid the possibility to create or associate them to a ticket.

 

Can you help us?

 

Best regards
fields.summary: Ability to archive request types (not only hidden, but not be possible to open ticket (through technician view) for those request types)

fields.description: I submit the idea, that the pages should adapt when you zoom in and out to have a better visual of tables for example.
fields.summary: Adaptation of the page when zooming out

fields.description:
*Current behavior :*

When a field value is hidden for a Request Type, its preset value needs to be set. When the *Create service request* action is used in an Automation rule for that Request Type, the value of the preset field needs to be configured separately.

 *Expected behavior:*

It would be great if the preset field can be removed while configuring the *Create service request* in the Automation rule.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the preset field from the Create service request in Automation

fields.description: Bug in sign in process
fields.summary: Signin

fields.description: I need the ability to add any and all the fields that are on the Request form to the Requests list on the Portal.
fields.summary: Ability to add all request fields as columns to Requests Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Emails containing some text inside a <pre> HTML tag will render the text in one line, even though the text might contain multiple lines. This only applies to preformatted text that does not contain HTML formatting inside the <pre> tag.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email containing text inside a <pre> HTML tag to the Jira Service Management Mail Handler.

h3. Expected Results
Text inside a <pre> tag should be shown as it is in the email received by Jira, no matter if the text contains HTML formatting or not.

h3. Actual Results
The text inside the <pre> tag is added to a single line.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Service Management Mail Handler adds pre-formatted text from email body to a single line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to browse for Objects in "Reporter information", Jira throws an error: "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In order to replicate this issue you need:
 # To set up a transition with an insight custom field
This field need to use the filter issue scope
 # Have a ticket without priority (one way to set this up is to import ticket using csv import and not set up a priority

 

Then the steps to reproduce are the following: 
 # Open the ticket without priority
 # Click on the transition with the insight field
 # Click on the insight field to fetch the values

h3. Expected Results

The values are displayed in a drop down list 
h3. Actual Results

Jira throws an error: "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
h3. Workaround

A workaround is to set the priority field of the ticket
fields.summary: Filling insight custom fields on transition screens throw an error "Jira server send error response"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portal Customer / Users synced with User provisioning with no license cannot browse for Insight objects o customer portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup an Insight field and add it to the customer portal.
 # Configure the Insight field with an IQL that involves user type attribute.
 # Add the user attribute as “searchable attributes” in the custom field configuration
 # Browse the objects from the portal as an agent
 # Browse the objects from the portal one of the users synced via provisioning and does not have a Jira license

h3. Expected Results

The user can browse the Insight objects in the Insight field
h3. Actual Results

The user cannot browse the Insight objects unless provided with product access:
!image-2021-11-09-15-25-38-083.png|thumbnail!
{quote}"errorMessage":"An error occurred","reasonKey":"cmdb.generic.error","reasonCode":"500"
{quote}
h3. Notes

The issue only impacts portal customer or users synced via user provisioning without a license 
h3. Workaround

As an agent, use the _Raise a request on behalf of_ option on the portal or update the Insight objects after an issue is created
fields.summary: Portal customers/Users synced with User provisioning with no license cannot browse for Insight objects on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the Add-on "AWS Service Catalog for JSM Cloud" has multiple AWS accounts linked, all the accounts will be selectable. 


h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a way for admins to select which AWS accounts to be permitted for certain service projects

h3. Workaround
You can restrict groups in  AWS Service Catalog account settings:
1. Open AWS Service Catalog account settings.
2. Choose an account and click 'manage'
3. Choose portfolio and choose groups, which can request or approve provisioning
fields.summary: Allow admins to select AWS account per service project in AWS Service Catalog for JSM Cloud App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an Insight field has its filter issue scope setting configured with ${reporter}, this field does not return any objects for some customers in the customer portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your Service Desk project - Project settings > People
 # Invite an user as a Service Desk Customer from there
 # Create an Insight object with Jira User attribute. e.g. Owner
 # Assign the user invited in step 2 to the Owner attribute of the object
 # Set up an Insight custom field with this query in filter issue scope field: {{"Owner" == ${reporter.label}}}
 # Log in as the user in step 2
 # Try to use the Insight field in customer portal

*Note:* For customers invited via the Customers page, they can successfully select the object where they are the Owner of in the customer portal.
h3. Expected Results

We expect at least 1 object to be returned and displayed as an option in the Insight field.
h3. Actual Results

There is no results displayed in the Insight field.
h3. Workaround

The only workaround possible is to remove the affected users' licenses turning them into simple customer accounts
fields.summary: Insight field with reporter placeholder in filter issue scope returns nothing for some customers in customer portal

fields.description:
Currently only single domain supported.

It would nice to allow specify multiple custom domains for statuspage.io page.
fields.summary: [StatusPage] Multiple custom domains

fields.description:
Hi,

I could not see where to log an enhancement suggestion for StatusPage so please move this to the correct team.

 

Idea: It would be great to create to add additional StatusPage event type beyond "Incidents" & "Maintenance". e.g. If a team wants to alert customers about a known issue that is not impacting the platform operationally but is generating service requests this may not fall into an "Incident" bucket or a "Maintenance" bucket. If we had a customizable bucket that had the same features as the Incident feature, but we could name it whatever was appropriate to the customer that would allow a lot of flexibility.
fields.summary: [StatusPage] Multiple custom domains

fields.description: We have various client sites, especially users working in a corporate/central role and configured as being part of these organizations would like the ability to export tickets and work with the data in a spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Ability to export tickets as per search criteria in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, we would like to translate the text "Search for Insight objects" that appears inside Insight Custom field on the portal. This is because not all users are aware of Insight objects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to change this text.
fields.summary: Translate the text "Search for Insight objects" in Insight custom field on the portal

fields.description:
Currently, if any user has a Jira Service Management license and access to an ITSM JSM project they will be able to raise a Major Incident in Opsgenie from a JSM project.

It would help if we can Restrict this to a particular User/Groups/Project Roles just like we have in Permissions, and not give permission to all users to raise Major Incidents.
fields.summary: Permission to control who can raise Major Incident from Jira Service Management to Opsgenie

fields.description:
Currently, while we raise a Major Incident from a Jira Service Management project to Opsgenie, the field that is displayed are restricted to :
* Impacted Service
* Incident Message
* Incident Description
* Priority
* Severity

It would help if we can edit this screen and add more fields to share more information on the Incident that is being raised in Opsgenie.
fields.summary: Additional fields while raising Major Incident.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Fields added through add-ons fail to load in the portal view if multiple requests are open. The fields in *Request details extension* section fail to load in the customer portal if multiple requests are opened simultaneously.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the add-ons *[Extension for Jira Service Management Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212161/extension-for-jira-service-management?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]* and *[Extra Fields for Jira Service Management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222530/extra-fields-for-jira-service-management?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]*
 # In a JSM project, go to *project settings* > *Request details extension*
 # In *Show fields* section, select and add a field
 # Go to *project settings* > *Portal Extra Fields*
 # Check the field selected in step 3 and click *Save Read Only Fields*
 # Now create 5-6 Jira issues in that JSM project
 # Open each issue in portal view as fast as possible.
 # The field chosen in step 3 will not load for those issues in portal view. Reloading the pages simultaneously will also not load the field. However, reload the pages 1 by 1 with some time gap and the field will load fine.
 # If I don't use any add-on and add the field(mentioned in step 5) in the request form, the field will load fine in portal view.
 # The problem can also be replicated if you reload those 5-6 Jira issues in portal view simultaneously.

h3. Expected Results

The fields are rendered seamlessly
h3. Actual Results

Check the [screen recording . 
|https://share.getcloudapp.com/7KuE7qwN]Instance Details|

[https://revvy-modeln.atlassian.net/]
h3. Workaround

Reload the portal view of the issue and then the fields will be loaded fine
fields.summary: Show/Render all fields from connect app(on heroku) on Request Details view

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option to copy the link to the issue in the portal when using the share option, instead of sending the link to the agent view in case we need to use it to share with the customer.
fields.summary: Add an option to share the portal link to the issue in the share option

fields.description:
Dear Support

I am writing on behalf of BV Holding.
We would like to ask you to change the Limit from 30 to 60 for the SLA calculation.
Can Time to resolution and Time to first response base sla entries be deleted?
Because we don't use them right now.

Thanks
Tibor Szondi
fields.summary: Change the SLA LIMITS from 30 to 60

fields.description: {color:#FF0000}export satisfaction report{color}
fields.summary: How can I export Satisfaction Report from Help desk?

fields.description:
+*DESCRIPTION:*+

Would like the ability to "prompt" customers/users when a specific priority is selected. For example:

If customer selects an urgent/high (P1/P2) priority for their issue they are reporting via help center, a message will appear that can be customizable and warn them before submitting a P1/P2
fields.summary: Ability to "prompt" customers/users when a specific priority is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Update incident" alert is shown when new JSM incidents don't have a Request type 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an incident issue on Jira without a Request type
# Add a Request type to the issue

h3. Expected Results
No alert is displayed
h3. Actual Results
The alert is displaying without mentioning which detail is missing.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: "Update incident" alert is shown when new JSM incidents don't have a Request type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All the Curl examples on the [Jira Service Management Cloud REST API page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/intro/] are wrong. They use bearer authentication instead of basic authentication with email address and API Token:
{code:java}
--header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
{code}
  
 instead of:
{code:java}
 --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>' \
{code}
 

 This is due to the fact that the [Authentication for REST API requests|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/intro/#authentication-for-rest-api-requests] section of the doc is still suggesting to use Oauth 1.0 that has been deprecated long time ago!
{quote} If you are integrating directly with the Jira Service Management Cloud REST APIs it is recommended to use [OAuth authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/] method.
{quote}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the [Authentication for REST API requests|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/intro/#authentication-for-rest-api-requests] section of the doc
 # See that it says  that it is recommended to use [OAuth authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/] method
 # Click on the link: "[OAuth authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/]" link

h3. Expected Results

The Oauth method is indeed recommended 

 
h3. Actual Results

At the top of the page it is clearly written that OAuth 1.0a is a legacy authentication method and, therefore, isn't recommended.
{quote}OAuth 1.0a is a legacy authentication method and, therefore, isn't recommended. Instead, check out the following for details of the recommended authentication approaches for:
 * Connect apps, see [Security for Connect apps|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/security-for-connect-apps].
 * Connect apps that act on behalf of the user, see [User impersonation for Connect apps|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/user-impersonation-for-connect-apps/].
 * Non-Connect apps created in the [developer console|https://developer.atlassian.com/console/myapps/], see [OAuth 2.0 (3LO) apps|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/oauth-2-authorization-code-grants-3lo-for-apps/].
 * Simple scripts or to make REST API calls yourself, see [Basic auth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/].

See [Integrating with Jira Service Management Cloud|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/integrating-with-jsd-cloud/] for more information on the options for developing with Jira Service Management Cloud.
{quote}
 
h3. Workaround

Use the [Basic authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication/] method with an [Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html] email address and [API token|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Vo71Nw]
fields.summary: The Curl examples in the REST API documentation for Jira Service Management Cloud are still using Oauth, that's deprecated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Basic user can't add Avatar while editing the object even with Object Schema Developers/Managers role.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provide Object Schema Developers/Managers role to a basic user.
 # As that user, try editing the object to upload Avatar

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to upload the Avatar in the object.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
Sorry, you do not have permission to perform this action. PermissionInsightException: User <AccountId> didn't have correct permission (admin).
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The user should be a site-admin or part of group "administrators" to upload the avatar.
fields.summary: Basic user can't add Avatar even with Object Schema Developers/Managers role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [GET /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/requesttype/\{requestTypeId}/field|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-servicedesk/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-servicedeskid-requesttype-requesttypeid-field-get] JSM REST API endpoint is only returning the default value for “multi choices” fields (e.g. select fields, check-boxes and radio buttons), while it is NOT returning the default value for the other fields, like:
 * Number Field
 * Date Picker
 * Date Time Picker
 * Labels
 * User Picker (single user)
 * User Picker (multiple users)
 * Text Field (single line)
 * Text Field (multi-line)
 * URL Field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create different kind of custom fields (e.g. check boxes, number field, radio button, URL field, etc) and make sure to set a default value for each of them.
 # Add the fields to a request type in a Service Desk project
 # Call the [Get request type fields|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-servicedesk/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-servicedeskid-requesttype-requesttypeid-field-get] REST API against the above request type

h3. Expected Results

The default value is returned for all the fields.
h3. Actual Results

The default value is only returned for some kind of fields. For example:
 * The default value is returned for the Check-Box field:
!checkbox_field_default_value.png|width=108,height=81!

 * No default value is returned for the Numeric field:
!number_field_default_value.png|width=141,height=67!

 
h3. Workaround

You can get the default value for all the custom fields by using the [Get custom field contexts default values|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-contexts/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-defaultvalue-get] Jira Platform REST API endpoint instead.
fields.summary: The Get request type fields REST API endpoint does not return the default value for all the field types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
Currently it's not possible to hide and set a default value for Insight custom fields based on request types.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to hide Insight fields from Portal

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Allow users to hide Insight fields from Portal

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates a workflow transition and adds the condition  *Hide transition from user*, JIRA Automation rules which use this transition would not be triggered.

(i) _It is important that the transition is triggered by an automation because they want the issue to be closed if no updates after a while, however they must use a different transition from the one visible to users because the ones visible to users have required fields that prevent the transition from being used. _

h5. Steps to Reproduce.

# Create a JIRA project.
# Edit the workflow reusing the transition that closes the issue, linking it between the first status the issue gets to upon creation (Waiting for Support) and Resolved Status.
# Add a condition to the transition: *Hide transition from user*
# Publish the Workflow.
# Create a new Automation Rule:
|*When*|Issue Created|
|*IF*|Issue Matches: summary ~ 'test'|
|*THEN*|Transition Issue:<_Your transition from the first status to Close_>|
# Create an Issue.

h5. Expected 

The automation rule would be able to automatically close the ticket.

h5. Actual Behavior

The automation rule would not be able to execute and close the ticket. This I suspect is because the automation rule is being run as a particular user.
fields.summary: Workflow Condition Breaks JIRA Automation Rule
